definition: seems as if/rather like/Taiwan pr. [si4 de5]
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

sentences.english: Farmers didn't have to scrambled to plant common vegetables this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年农民不再一窝蜂似的种大路菜了。

sentences.english: He is always tell the director how to run the business; that's like teach his grandmother to suck egg.
sentences.chinese: 他老是对总裁说该如何管理业务，就跟班门弄斧似的。

sentences.english: It was just his vulgar way of showing off.
sentences.chinese: 那样子就像歌唱演员表演似的，完全是庸俗的炫耀。

sentences.english: The white felt yurts of the Mongolian people stand out in the sunshine .
sentences.chinese: 在太阳下，那点点水泡似的蒙古包，闪烁着白光。

sentences.english: He has been leading an ivory-tower existence.
sentences.chinese: 他可是一直过着象牙塔似的生活。

sentences.english: There was nothing except shacks and muddy streets.
sentences.chinese: 那时只有低矮的窝棚似的小房子和泥泞的道路。

sentences.chinese: 图蒂假装晕倒，像卡通人物似的昏倒在地。

sentences.english: Its scythe-like tail into the water, the fishing line to slide down quickly also.
sentences.chinese: 它那大镰刀似的尾巴入水中后，钓丝也飞快地滑下去。

sentences.english: The shower head drizzled water on my head.
sentences.chinese: 莲蓬头把水像下毛毛雨似的洒在我头上。

sentences.english: Her delicate face flushed pink, her lips pouted softly, as if she were going to cry.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸激动的发红，轻轻地撅着嘴，仿佛要哭似的。

sentences.english: There was a rainbow of light and then they were through the hyper-space barrier.
sentences.chinese: 一道彩虹似的光闪过之后，他们就穿越了超空间壁垒。

sentences.english: The loveliest tinkle as of golden bells answered him.
sentences.chinese: 一个最可爱的叮叮声，像金铃似的回答了他。

sentences.english: Yes, well, that may be the proximal cause of our journey.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，这可能是我们这趟旅途最近似的原因了。

它使你看起来像傻瓜似的。

sentences.english: Too much late-night ice cream can blow up your physique.
